BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: NEW YORK SCHOOL OF INTERIOR DESIGN

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: the school prepares aspiring interior designers and working professionals to be leaders in the field by providing a focused and immersive interior design education.
IRS990.Desc: THE NEW YORK SCHOOL OF INTERIOR DESIGN IS AN INSTITUTION OF HIGHER LEARNING OFFERING THE FOLLOWING DEGREES: MFA, MPS, BA, BFA, AAS AND A DESIGN CERTIFICATE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PERMANENTLY AND TEMPORARILY RESTRICTED FUNDS ARE RESTRICTED BY DONORS PRIMARILY FOR SCHOLARSHIPS AND THE BOARD DESIGNATED FUNDS ARE RESTRICTED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES primarily FOR SCHOLARSHIPS AND LIBRARY ACQUISITIONS. THE FUNDS ARE HELD IN INVESTMENT ACCOUNTS AND WILL BE USED ONLY FOR PURPOSES STIPULATED BY THE DONORS OR AS DESIGNATED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES.
THE SCHOOL PUBLISHES ITS NONDISCRIMINATION POLICY IN ITS STUDENT HANDBOOK, WHICH IS EMAILED TO ALL STUDENTS THE FIRST week OF CLASSes FOR EACH SEMESTER.
THE SCHOOL RECEIVES GOVERNMENT GRANTS FROM THE NEW YORK STATE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION, AND THE UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION.

A STUDENT MUST COMPLETE A FAFSA APPLICATION FOR THE GIVEN ACADEMIC YEAR. THE STuDENT MUST BE ENROLLED IN A DEGREE SEEKING PROGRAM; NON MATRICULATED STUDENTS ARE NOT ELIGIBLE FOR FINANCIAL AID FUNDS. STUDENTS MUST ENROLL FOR AT LEAST 6 CREDITS TO RECEIVE ANY FEDERAL FUNDS, EXCEPT STUDENTS WHO QUALIFY FOR THE PELL GRANT PROGRAM. UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS MUST MAINTAIN A CUMULATIVE GPA OF 2.0 AND GRADUATE STUDENTS MUST MAINTAIN A CUMULATIVE GPA OF 3.0 EACH SEMESTER.

NEW YORK SCHOOL OF INTERIOR DESIGN, (THE "SCHOOL") prepares aspiring interior designers and working professionals to be leaders in the field by providing a focused and immersive interior design education drawing upon an expert faculty, innovative approaches, and close industry relationships.

THE SCHOOL'S FINANCIAL OVERVIEW COMMITTEE REVIEWED THE CONTENTS OF THE FORM 990 AND AUTHORIZED THE FILING WITH THE IRS. A COPY OF THE FINAL FORM 990 WAS MADE AVAILABLE TO EACH VOTING MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES PRIOR TO THE OFFICIAL FILING.

EACH VOTING MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES AND KEY INSTITUTIONAL EMPLOYEES ARE REQUIRED TO SIGN A CONFLICT OF INTEREST AND DISCLOSURE POLICY AT THE FIRST (SEPT) QUARTERLY MEETING OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. ANY SUCH INDIVIDUALS ARE REQUIRED TO CONFER WITH EITHER THE PRESIDENT OR VICE PRESIDENT OF FINANCE AND ADMINISTRATION IF THEY, OR THE INSTITUTION, SUSPECT A RELATIONSHIP OR TRANSACTION POSES A CONFLICT OF INTEREST. EITHER THE PRESIDENT OR VICE PRESIDENT OF FINANCE AND ADMINISTRATION WILL CONSIDER THE POTENTIAL FOR A CONFLICT AND APPROPRIATE STEPS NECESSARY TO AVOID OR REMEDIATE THAT CONFLICT. MOREOVER, AS PART OF THE BOARD'S ONGOING ASSESSMENT OF ITSELF, COMPLIANCE WITH THE INSTITUTION'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS ROUTINELY EVALUATED AND ENFORCED.

THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES PERIODICALLY RETAINS THE SERVICES OF A COMPENSATION CONSULTANT TO EVALUATE COMPENSATION FOR THE INSTITUTION'S CEO AND OTHER KEY EMPLOYEES. THE COMPENSATION CONSULTANT USES CONTEMPORANEOUS COMPENSATION DATA BY POSITION AND ADJUSTS FOR SIZE, COMPLEXITY, OPERATING BUDGET AND LOCATION OF INSTITUTION. SALARY AND BENEFIT LEVELS FOR THE PRESIDENT AND SENIOR STAFF (VICE PRESIDENTS) ARE EVALUATED ON THE OCCASION OF THE APPOINTMENT OF A NEW (AND THE SITTING) PRESIDENT. COMPENSATION FOR THE CEO IS REVIEWED DURING THE NEGOTIATIONS OF THE CEO'S MULTI-YEAR CONTRACT. ANY SUBSTANTIAL INCREASE IN SALARY IS BASED ON COMPARABLE DATA, PERFORMANCE AND PROGRESS TOWARD RESEARCHING ESTABLISHED GOALS AND BENCHMARKS. THE BOARD CHAIR DETERMINES ANY SUBSTANTIAL INCREASES IN SALARY FOR THE PRESIDENT. THE PRESIDENT MAKES THE DETERMINATION ABOUT THE SALARY INCREASES FOR KEY EMPLOYEES, IN CONSULTATION, IF NECESSARY, WITH THE FINANCIAL OVERVIEW COMMITTEE.
THE INSTITUTION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST. .
